column5: I spent some time last week with my son, tearing apart 2 old broken GTs.  We managed to build on good working one.  He's been patiently waiting for the snow.  I saw on the radar that port Severn area and North where getting some snow yesterday.  Anyone up that way care to share a snow report??  It would save me a couple hours of driving and potentially a lot of disappointment for the young lad..
Heard on the news last night that Barrie was getting dumped on, or did I hear wrong ??
From what I saw on radar last night there was heavy bands going west east from g bay right from washago to g'hurst.  Michael
Heard wrong Lew ,lol.Still see the grass.
Heard wrong Lew ,lol  Story of my life
Minden got 14 inches, that likely doesn't help you though  GTs are great. I've got 2, just waiting for my son to be old enough, fun to tow behind the Bravo too
A friend just let me know the bracebridge has enough for a fun time.  Not sure if we want to drive that far!
Never fails I hurt myself on one every year once the old snowboarder in me comes out????  Good fun those gt's
I found a good dumping on our old Cottage road at 6-mile Lake.  We had a blast!!
Drove thru Minden and Dorset today...they got hammered!  Lots of snowmobile across front lawns haha.  Still bare grass up here

Norland got a decent about yesterday too based on the pic's sent to me. Lindsay is all green right now.  *edit to add* at my age I should know better to not try tricks but I never learn. More so at a family property where there is a mini half pipe to play in going down the hills...
You know it geoff!!! And boy does it hurt taking a gt off a 12 foot kicker with no powder landing hahahahah.  Lil mini half pipe would be killer fun!!!!
